citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Protocol A was approved by the IACUC. However, there is no statement providing a rationale for the appropriateness of
the species chosen for the study. It is the responsibility of the IACUC to ensure protocols are complete and contain all the
required information before approval. Each proposal for animal use must contain all required elements per regulation to
allow the IACUC to fully understand and adequately review the proposed activities. Correct by September 30, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives and the IO.
n

narrative:
2.31(e)(2) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
Protocol A was approved by the IACUC. However, there is no statement providing a rationale for the appropriateness of 
the species chosen for the study. It is the responsibility of the IACUC to ensure protocols are complete and contain all the 
required information before approval. Each proposal for animal use must contain all required elements per regulation to 
allow the IACUC to fully understand and adequately review the proposed activities. Correct by September 30, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives and the IO. 
 
 n
